learning_outcomes.description: Describe the major alternative methodologies used in developing information systems and the considerations involved in choosing which methodology to use.
Analyse a business need within a complex environment and develop an appropriate strategy to meet the need, and provide the required information service.
Prepare and use various information gathering techniques for eliciting user information requirements and system expectations.
Construct a variety of system description documents, following agile methodology, including a working prototype.
Explain, collaborate, and innovate through information systems development to address business challenges as an individual and as part of a team.

assessments.due_date:
In-semester Saturday

28/03/2026 - 2/05/2026

This exam is centrally scheduled which means the exam date depends on when the university schedules this exam. Possible dates are: 28 Mar, 18 Apr, and 2 May 2026.
assessments.task_description:
The In-Semester Exam tests students' knowledge about the course. It will be short answer questions and MCQs.

AI Statement:

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the UQ Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Analysis and Design UML Modelling with Enterprise Architect Assessment
assessments.due_date:
Week 9 Mon - Fri

The assessment takes place during the tutorial time in Week 9. Student can only take the assessment during their enrolled tutorial times.
assessments.task_description:
In this assessment, you will be presented with scenarios, and you will need to utilize Enterprise Architecture to create specific UML models for each scenario as requested.

The assessment will take place in Week 9 during the enrolled tutorial time. Alternative arrangements will be announced in the lecture.

You are welcome to bring handwritten notes and printed materials. You are not allowed to use any other materials, esp. not to browse the Internet or use Artificial Intelligence solutions to create the models for you.

The assignment details are given on the course's Blackboard site (i.e., the course's Learn.UQ site). 

This assessment addresses at least one PRME Sustainable Development Goal and is an opportunity to add an innovative solution to your ePortfolio.

AI Statement:

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills, and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submitted an Enterprise Architect File via Blackboard assessment link at the end of the assessment period while you are still sitting in the classroom. For details please refer to the assignment specification on the Blackboard site for the course.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
Written Project Report (word file and slides) Week 11, Fri 2:00 pm

Presentation during Tutorials Week 12, Mon 9:00 am

The assessment focus is a team pressentation on the design, analysis and development of an information system (i.e., an app). To support the presentation, project report (Word file and the slides) must be submitted via the available Blackboard link. The presentation is in Week 12 (and if required, Week 13) during the tutorial time.
assessments.category: Creative Production/ Exhibition, Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Practical/ Demonstration, Presentation, Product/ Design
assessments.task_description:
During the semester, students learn how to analyse, design, and develop information systems. The assessment tests students' skills related to these tasks with a focus on effective implementation of the formative feedback and an authentic presentation. Details about the assessment are on Blackboard in week 2.

This assessment is based on group work: Each group can have a maximum of 5 students, all of whom must come from the same tutorial.

Students will be asked to submit an early report for this project (after Week 3) and receive formative in-person feedback. By this time, the group members have to be known and submitted.

The presentations will be scheduled for week 12 (and, if necessary, in Week 13). The schedule will be created once enrolments are finalised. All students must be present at their group presentation; otherwise, the student will receive a failing grade. Students' grades are also determined based on peer assessment.

Please note: The presentation will be recorded to aid teaching staff with marking in accordance with UQ Policy.

AI Statement:

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills, and knowledge in analysing and designing information systems. As taught in the course, these activities can be supported by AI. Thus, students are free to use generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) in this assessment; however, the report and presentation must clearly explain how (i.e., which software and which features) it was used and where it was applied. Failure to do so will impact the marks. Use of AI when declared will not result in reduced marks.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The report (including a Word file and a PowerPoint presentation) will be submitted as a zip.file via the links provided on Blackboard, and the project (app and ppt) is to be presented during the presentation.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
